Package helper

Class DateTimeProcessing

java.lang.Object
helper.DateTimeProcessing
public class DateTimeProcessing extends Object
Collection of static helper methods which manipulate dates and times.

  • Method Details

    • splitDateTime

      public static String[] splitDateTime(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a timestamp to an array which contain the date, hour, minute, and second as strings.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - Passed in timestamp to be processed.
      Returns:
      Returns an array [DATE STRING, HOUR STRING, MINUTE STRING, SECOND STRING]

    • importTimeToLocal

      public static Timestamp importTimeToLocal(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a passed UTC timestamp to the system default time.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - Timestamp to convert to system time zone
      Returns:
      Returns a timestamp in the system default time.

    • exportTimeToUtc

      public static Timestamp exportTimeToUtc(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a passed system timestamp to UTC.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - Timestamp to convert to UTC time.
      Returns:
      Returns a timestamp in UTC time.

    • dateTimeToEST

      public static Timestamp dateTimeToEST(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a passed system timestamp to EST.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - Timestamp to convert to EST time.
      Returns:
      Returns a timestamp in UTC time.

    • stringToDateTime

      public static Timestamp stringToDateTime(String dateTimeString)
      Converts a passed string "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" to a timestamp.
      Parameters:
      dateTimeString - String formatted "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" to convert to a timestamp
      Returns:
      Returns a timestamp of the passed string.

    • timestampToEpoch

      public static long timestampToEpoch(Timestamp timestamp)
      Converts a passed timestamp to java epoch second (Seconds from "1970-01-01T00:00:00Z").
      Parameters:
      timestamp - Timestamp to convert to epoch.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of seconds from "1970-01-01T00:00:00Z" as long.

    • timestampArrToEpoch

      public static long[] timestampArrToEpoch(Timestamp[] timestampArr)
      Converts a passed array of timestamps to java epoch second (Seconds from "1970-01-01T00:00:00Z"). Used to combine a series of dates for comparison.
      Parameters:
      timestampArr - Array of timestamps to convert to epoch.
      Returns:
      Returns an array of numbers that are the numbers of seconds from "1970-01-01T00:00:00Z" as long.
